sen.j: 管領代（かんれいだい）とは室町幕府の職名。
sen.e: Kanreidai is the job title in the Muromachi Shognate (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun.)
Kanrei-dai was a job title within the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: Muromachi Shogunate (although I like this better, it is not consistent with other articles)→Muromachi bakufu
sen.e: "Kanrei-dai" was a job title within the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 統一リスト（その他 2009/6/29）の指示により、Kanrei-dai にダブルクォーテーションを追記しました。

sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 常設の職ではなく臨時職であり、当初は三管領の一族が管領を代行した際に管領代と称された。
sen.e: Kanrei-dai was not a permanent position but a temporary one and it was called Kanrei-dai when, at first, the three families of Kanrei (shogunal deputy) acted for Kanrei.
Kanrei-dai was a temporary post rather than a permanent one, initially referring to a time when one of the three Kanrei families acted as the Kanrei (shogunal deputy).
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more smoothly
sen.e: Kanrei-dai was a temporary post rather than a permanent one, initially referring to a time when one of the three Kanrei families acted as the Kanrei (shogunal deputy).

sen.j: 明応の政変以降には三管領家以外の有力者が幕府の実権を司った際に任じられた。
sen.e: At the Coup of Meio or later, Karei-dai was assigned to the dominant figures in politics other than the ones from the three Kanrei families when the dominant figures held the power of the shogunate.
After the Meio Political Crisis when dominant figures in politics outside of the three Kanrei families held the real power of the shogunate, other personages assumed the post of Kanrei-dai.
sen.cmt: Coup of Meio→Meio Political Crisis; fixed grammar
sen.e: After the Meio Coup when dominant figures in politics outside of the three Kanrei families held the real power of the shogunate, other personages assumed the post of Kanrei-dai.
sen.cmt: 調査指示書入力要領に従いMeio Political Crisis をMeio Coup に修正しました。

sen.j: 代表的な管領代は大内義興、三好長慶、六角定頼。
sen.e: The most well-known Kanrei-dai are Yoshioki OCHI, Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and Sadayori ROKKAKU.
The most well known among Kanrei-dai were Yoshioki OCHI, Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and Sadayori ROKKAKU.
The most well known among Kanrei-dai were Yoshioki OUCHI, Nagayoshi MIYOSHI and Sadayori ROKKAKU.
sen.cmt: 用語集の表記に従い、Yoshioki OCHI を Yoshioki OUCHI に修正しました。

sen.j: 特に前二者は一時的ながら政権を樹立しており、天下人として扱われることもある。
sen.e: Especially, since OCHI and MIYOSHI established, though temporarily, their own government, they are sometimes treated as tenkabito (person becoming the ruler of the country.)
In particular were OCHI and MIYOSHI, who, despite their commision being temporary, were sometimes even called tenkabito (ruler of the country).
In particular were OUCHI and MIYOSHI, who, despite their commission being temporary, were sometimes even called tenkabito (ruler of the country).
sen.cmt: OCHI を OUCHI に修正しました。 commision を commission に修正しました。

sen.j: 信長公記では、織田信長が准管領となったとするが、この地位が管領代と同一のものか、そもそも就任の事実があったかは不明である。
sen.e: According to Shinchoko-ki (Biography of Nobunaga ODA), it tells that Nobunaga became jun-kanrei (deputy Kanrei), but whether the position was identical to Kanrei-dai is not clear.
According to Shinchoko-ki (The Biography of Nobunaga ODA), Nobunaga became jun-kanrei (deputy kanrei), but it is not clear whether or not the position was identical to the post of Kanrei-dai.

According to Shinchoko-ki (The Biography of Nobunaga ODA), Nobunaga became jun-kanrei (deputy kanrei), but it is not clear whether or not the position was identical to the post of Kanrei-dai or even his assumption of the post.
sen.cmt: 「そもそも就任の事実があったか」訳漏れor even his assumption of the post を追記して訳漏れ対応しました。

sen.j: また細川管領家の当主右京兆の代官である右京兆代という職も存在しているが、管領代に含めるかどうかは検討の余地がある。
sen.e: There was a name ukeicho that was another name of the head of Hosokawa Kanrei family and the title Ukeicho-dai (the deputy provisional master of right) existed but whether it should be included in Kanrei-dai leaves the room for examination.

As the head of the Hosokawa kanrei family, one held the title of "deputy of ukeicho," and a position called Ukeicho-dai (deputy provisional master of right) even existed, but there is room for examination on whether or not the position should be included as a Kanrei-dai.
sen.cmt: I do not understand what 右京兆 is supposed to mean.
sen.e: As the head of the Hosokawa kanrei family, one held the title of deputy of ukeicho, and a position called Ukeicho-dai (deputy provisional master of right) even existed, but there is room for examination on whether or not the position should be included as a Kanrei-dai.
sen.cmt: "deputy of ukeicho," のダブルクォーテーションを削除しました。
